name: Quaker Square Inn at The University of Akron

reviews.text: The Quaker Inn is a very interesting place, and it could be thought of as a once in a lifetime experience. That was part of why I stayed there - I mean, how often can you get to sleep in an old grain silo? And one that is beautifully make up? Yes, my room was beautiful. And round, of course. The lobby was very interesting, with old pictures, gears and sculptures on the walls. Really, even if you don't stay, the lobby is worth a look. My bed was comfy, the room was large, the shower had great pressure, and the towels were big and thick. That being said, the tub drained just a little slow and th tub grout could have been a little cleaner. Neither of those things made me go "eww!", though. Breakfast was hot and good - eggs, sausage, make-your-own waffles, various breads, and of course, oatmeal. Juice, cofffee, etc, and apples and oranges. Is the place perfect. No, but what place is? Is is cheap? Not especially, but you get a unique experience for it. I would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Fun adventure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing time staying at Quaker Square. The staff was friendly and who wouldn't want to stay in a grain shilo??
reviews.title: Kirsten and Matt's Wedding was a blast and Quaker Squares history made her big day even more special.

reviews.text: I loved this hotel because it was so spacious and unusual. The meeting and reception areas are huge, round, and would be perfect for large gatherings. The decor in the lobby and reception areas is a little dated (from the '80s) but still so unique and eye-catching. The rooms were large and clean although the AC was loud and had a hard time cooling the entire space evenly. My biggest complaint was that the lovely pool area was closed. With small children in July, we counted on the entertainment of this pool. The hotel sent us to the University of Akron leisure pool - which was amazing but very inconvenient. The staff was not friendly.
reviews.title: Grand hotel with unique quirkiness.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place,Inside Silos converted into great bedrooms. Everything about circularity. Friendly helpful people. Train cars set up for dining. Lots of history
reviews.title: dimensional journey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because of the uniqueness of sleeping in an old grain silo. It was amazing to see the interior (lobby) of this hotel. I really loved the lobby decor, the interesting pictures of the Quaker Oats guy and the 'old-time ads', etc. I wouldn't give this hotel a bad rating, but I wouldn't give it a great rating either. The front desk reception guy was lackluster, unsmiling, and seemed to want to be somewhere else. The room was clean, and served it's purpose - for sleep and showering. Every room has a balcony, but since only the first 3 floors are used by hotel guests, we ended up with a balcony that was level with the tar paper roof. It was depressing to even look out the door. The ice machine on our floor was ripped out of the wall, so I had to go to the floor below to get ice, but I had to take the slow elevator because the stairwell only leads outside. That was inconvenient. We stayed two nights and on the second day, we returned to the hotel after biking the C&O canal trail, to find that our room keys were deactivated. We were in a room that was on the third floor and waaaaay down at the end of the hall. We had to go all the way back down to the front desk and deal with the lackluster reception guy. He didn't offer an apology for the inconvenience. They offer a free continental breakfast which was ok. The syrup tasted like pure sugar in brown sticky liquid with no maple flavor at all. One of the most disappointing things for me was that none of the shops at Quaker Square are open anymore. It's like a ghost town. The only shop that is open is the General Store, but it has such limited hours (11am - 4pm), and we happened to never be around at the time the store was open. We paid about $130 for a king bed room, which I thought was a little steep for the quality that we encountered, but I'm glad we stayed here because it sounds like this hotel will be taken over completely by Univ. of Akron for their student housing. On the really positive side, the wifi is free and we had no problems connecting.
reviews.title: Unique place, but overpriced.

reviews.text: Being built into the old silos, these rooms are huge – and thanks to the think concrete walls and circular room, they are extremely quiet. This is a fun, different, yet very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Quietest Rooms Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The round rooms were interesting. Very clean. Brunch was better than average. Disappointed that the pool was closed for renovating.
reviews.title: interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first stay at the Quaker. I felt that the room we had was very ordinary in terms of furnishings. However, the main areas of the building were beautiful and the staff was top-notch and very friendly and helpful. I stayed for a wedding that was happening at the Quaker, and their facilities seemed well-suited to the event.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay in Akron

reviews.text: We were in town for a funeral and chose to stay at the Quaker Square because of it's central location. Also, I had stayed here 20+ years ago when it was the Quaker Hilton and wanted to stay again. We were in room 202 which is 3/4 of a circle with the bathroom cutting into part of the room. My sister-in-law stayed in rooom 104 (Smoking) which is a full circle with the bathroom off of it. Her room obviously had more space, but we had no problem with lack of space in ours. Currently the University of Akron owns it, so floors 4-8 house honor students - they need a special card to swipe to get to those floors. But it looks and feels like a hotel. The rooms were roomy and round - which our kids thought was great. The bathrooms were adequate size. The towels were soft, water pressure was great and water stayed hot. The rooms are lit by several lamps around the room - table, night stands. But there is no overhead light. There is sliding glass door that leads to a small balcony and with the curtains open there is plenty of natural light. The room was clean, the bed linens clean, and the pillows were comfy. The weather was in the 50's during our stay, but we did not have to turn on the heat at all. The breakfast in the morning was great. The kids loved using the waffle maker. They also offered oatmeal which was well made. The bacon was crispy and so good. They offer another hot item which differs each day - french toast bake, scrambled eggs or breakfast burrito. Coffee with real cream, variety of juices, bagels, cereal. All was delicious. The dining area is large and the tables vary from 2 seats to 8 seats. Great for families. We did see some students having breakfast - but everyone is polite. I have a bigger problem with adults acting obnoxious. And only the Akron shirts gave it away they might be students. The hotel staff were more than helpful and friendly. There is a Trackside Grill that opens at 11 and closes around 6-8 depending on the day. There is a general store that sells subs and snacks/drinks. There is one store that sells a variety of different items. It connects to a small museum where you can push buttons and see a train and circus move. They had a neat video about the hotel and the history of Quaker. Everything I look for in a hotel was here and I hope to stay again when we visit.
reviews.title: Hope to Stay Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, different, rooms are round except where straight walls were added to form bathroom. Elevators are slow. Starting to show signs of needing updated. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms are small and room lighting is poor.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were un town for an event and the hotel was in close proximity to everything. easy in and out priveledges and easy to get around town with out getting lost. the staff was very helpful with directions and even able to recommend some local fare ie. restaurants and shops. would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: great experience with a comf/cozy feel.

reviews.text: We had two rooms booked for the Akron Marathon. The rooms were clean and spacious, however when I reserved them months ago, I was told that I could have late-check out so we could shower after the 26.2 mile race. When we arrived, we were told we could not return unless we paid for another night. Our other friends stayed elsewhere for much less cost, had a shuttle to the start line of the race, and were given late check-out without any problem. I would not recommend this hotel (also a dorm) to anyone in the future. The customer service was as bad as I've ever seen.
reviews.title: terrible customer service

reviews.text: Very nice room. The pillows were awesome! Didn't need to bring our own this time.
reviews.title: Very impressed at how clean the room was.

reviews.text: Good location to the Akron Civic Theater. About a three block walk.
reviews.title: A hotel and a college dorm must be separate

reviews.text: Complimentary breakfast was very good. Better than most continental breakfast at other hotels.
reviews.title: Quaker Square
Dated rooms, shared "hotel" with college dorm.
reviews.text: My traveling bio: 27 yrs old, stayed because it was the room block for a wedding. Traveled with wife. Typical hotel room I stay in is roughly $100-$150 per night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - This hotel is a joke. I hate to be so harsh, but I would never stay here again. The rooms were outdated and had an odor. They were clean... but not pretty. The rooms are all circular, which is supposed to be appealing due to the history (old quaker oats plant), but it just didn't work for me. The halls felt old and creepy - like a haunted house...
reviews.title: Very welcoming staff - a fun and unique place to stay! Would visit again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The hotel acts as both a hotel and a dorm. This also was not appealing. It was "move in" weekend when I stayed there, meaning it was crawling with freshmen moving in to college. This is not great when you are spending $100/night.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel I ever stayed in

reviews.text: - Location was great - right downtown Akron.
reviews.title: Worth the price of the stay - if not just to admire the architecture!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The pool was not open during our stay, although they have one.
reviews.title: Once in the lifetime experience.

aka: Quaker Square Inn At The University Of Akron Hotel Akron
